<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">thus makes

              <sic>Sh<hi rend="superscript">re</hi></sic>
              <corr>Shakespeare</corr>
            </choice></rs> in his own image. <del>
            <choice>
              <sic>Shre</sic>
              <corr>Shakespeare</corr>
            </choice> is infinitely various.</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>
            <choice>
              <sic>Sh<hi rend="superscript">re</hi></sic>
              <corr>Shakespeare</corr>
            </choice> changes with every play. That is a good reason</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">it <del>proves</del>   <del>If we</del> We cannot <del>tether</del> him; he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>He</del> It is one of the <add place="above">[differently?]</add> <del>baffling</del> <add place="above">but</add>, perpetually obliterating:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>rubbing</del> <del>all</del> <del>& consumed</del> so <add>[commonly?] [expression?]</add> consumed, that he he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">has no separate existence. <del>The firs</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And when in 
            <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha" key="Shakespeare, William"><choice>
              <sic>Sh<hi rend="superscript">re</hi></sic>
              <corr>Shakespeare</corr>
            </choice></rs> this pressure to say [illeg.] through other</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">people [must? mock?], the <del>single</del> person who is saying them is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">obliterated. <del>And</del> <del>The reader</del> <del>is not</del> On the one hand</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">we have the most completely articulate of men:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& at the same time, nobody in particular. This</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is this that makes criticism inadequate. The</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>critic tries to [impute?] his own measure</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& set enthralling. <del>Very few of the [illeg.]</del> <del>There is</del> It is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">impossible to read him without feeling his presence:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but    to feel always that he is there: & at the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">same time that he is somewhere else.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to feel that he is, more than any other poet,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the poet who <del>says</del> <del>spe</del> expresses; <del>&</del> And every reader</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">has a dozen methods of [courting?] him   <del>there is</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the</del> I will, says one, visualise him: &:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He was fine & generous; & if we like to add, about</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">middle height with a [clothed?] fine head, no one offends.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He certainly walked down <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-blac" key="Blackfriars">Blackfriars</rs>: & ate at times</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-merm" key="Mermaid, The">Mermaid</rs>. That line soon closes. The other –</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">which ambitiously casts a line round the plays</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">cannot succeed because it is different every time.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Do they show a regular development?</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">A force of nature? Is there a pinnacle?</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Is there a decline? <del>Did the</del> Was the</l>

            <choice>
              <sic>fr.</sic>
              <corr>from</corr>
            </choice> body [illeg.]: or from the inadequacy</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">hard upon the letter. And [struggle?] of all, the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">form. For it seems unnatural, that a body</l>
